de.pifpafpuf.web.html

Class HtmlText

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.pifpafpuf.web.html.HtmlText
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Stringable

    public class HtmlText
extends Object
implements Stringable
    is a text node within an HTML DOM tree.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static HtmlText fromEncoded(String encodedText)
      creates a text node from already properly HTML encoded text.
      static HtmlText fromRaw(String text)
      creates a text node from raw text.
      void print(Appendable out, int indent)
      appends the object's string representation to out, possibly using an indent of the given number of whitespace characters.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • fromRaw

        public static HtmlText fromRaw(String text)
        creates a text node from raw text. The text will be properly HTML encoded on output.

      • fromEncoded

        public static HtmlText fromEncoded(String encodedText)
        creates a text node from already properly HTML encoded text. The text will not be HTML encoded again on output.

      • print

        public void print(Appendable out,
         int indent)
           throws IOException
        Description copied from interface: Stringable
        appends the object's string representation to out, possibly using an indent of the given number of whitespace characters. Whether and where line breaks and indentation is used, is free to the implementing object.
        Specified by:
        print in interface Stringable
        Parameters:
        out - is the stream to append the text to
        indent - must be used right after line breaks inserted
        Throws:
        IOException
